title: Doctor Who
filename: 171 - The Seeds of War - Matt Fitton & Nicholas Briggs_djvu.txt

elements.text: PART ONE
Scene 1: INT. EMINENCE MIND
FX: AMID SEETHING, HISSING GASES, A VOICE OF DEATH
He is approaching.
Closer.
Ever closer.
The mind of the ancient... Reach out to us again... The Eminence senses hin... The Doctor...
The Doctor is returning to us...
THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 4
Scene 2: INT. TARDIS, CONSOLE ROOM
FX: B/G TARDIS HUM
FX: DOCTOR RUMMAGING THROUGH CHEST, EACH ITEM TOSSED ASIDE

(TO HIMSELF) Let me see... Delphinian passports... Multi-galactic power adaptors... Jelly babies... jelly babies... why did I ever need so many jelly babies? (SURPRISED) Stalos gyro! I wondered where that went... (GETTING FRUSTRATED) Oh... they’re in here somewhere...
(ENTERING) Here you are, Doctor!
(MUFFLED) Have you found them?
No. I mean... This is where you are! You disappeared. I went to look for that mythical swimming pool of yours... And now you've made a mess of the control room. Look at all this junk!
Junk?!
And where did you drag that old chest from? Looks like it was buried by Long John Silver himself.
Don’t you mean Captain Flint, Melanie? A TARDIS storage locker
is hardly Treasure Island.
It’s my rainy-day chest. Far from being ‘junk’, these are all things for use or entertainment when we’re at a loose end.
Come on, Mel. Give me a hand!
But I’ve no idea what you’re looking for!
‘The cloud-capped towers, the gorgeous palaces...’
Eiffel... Pisa... the Empire State... even Babel... Mere pimples on the face of the Earth compared to this.
FINDING TICKETS) Ah-ha! Here we are. (FX: CHEST CLOSED
THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 5
Go on then. You’re obviously dying to tell me...
Two complimentary tickets to the grand opening of the Great Tower of Kalsos!
Kalsos? Never heard of it!
No reason that you should. It’s centuries into your future. When the human race has established colonies far beyond the solar system.

There had been other... taller constructions back on Earth, but not without some form of geostationary support. When I visited the so-called Space Elevator of Sumatra, several lifetimes ago, for instance...
Doctor... You were talking about Kalsos?

(FX: SETTING CONTROLS) Kalsos. Yes. The people were renowned engineers. The Great Tower is the tallest free-standing structure in the colonies. Almost two miles wide at ground level, the summit reaches to the edge of space.
What was it for? Why did they build it?

Because they could! As well as a miracle of construction, it’s a marvel of computer technology. Everything’s automated. Even the artificial atmosphere on the higher levels. All regulated by an enormous A.I. system.
Here. Take a look at the tickets.
(TAKING TICKETS) Let me see. Oooh... we get a tour of the control
centre!
Thought you’d like that!
And dinner too!
THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB
Page 6
Ah yes. The revolving restaurant at the summit is a quite breathtaking venue. Literally. It needs its own oxygen supply.
The environmental controls are so precise the maitre d’ can lace the air around your table with aromatic herbs and spices
to complement the food...
Hmm... I’m not sure I like the sound of that. what I’m eating, thank you very much.
Heston Blumenthal has a lot to answer for.
Who?
After your time. Oh, I’m looking forward to
roast...
(WARNING) Doctor...
. er roast... butternut squash.
I'd rather taste
a nice,
I can see I’m going to have to count your calories.
Don’t worry, Mel. There is a vegetarian option... And
on the 200t® floor... Not to mention all those stairs...
juicy
a gymnasium
For once, I think even I’d take the lift. Better get changed
for dinner then!
Oh, I was hoping you might be able to help in here.
You mean I get to fly the TARDIS at last?
Er... no.. You need to put all this ‘junk’ back in that box...
THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 7
Scene 3: INT. TEVELER HOUSE ON RIDIOUS IV
FX: FUZZY BROADCAST, WITH BOMBASTIC MILITARY SOUNDTRACK
(DISTORTED, SNATCHES OF COMMENTARY BETWEEN STATIC ON MALFUNCTIONING VID-UNIT) [.. back to Kalsos. We will be with you

every step of the way for this momentous occasion. The end of the war. The magnificent spectacle of our returning Earth Alliance fleet. Out satellite cameras bring you an unparalleled view of our boys and girls as they make their way back across the system after so many years away...}
Oh... stupid thing! Why won’t you work!
FX: RATTLING CONTROLS
FX: OUTER DOOR OPENS, HELGERT TRUDGES INTO HALLWAY, OFF
(OFF) Sisrella? Sisrella! What are you doing?
(CALLING) It’s the vid-unit. The picture’s gone... again!
FX: CLANGS IT WITH A FIST
My daughter. The engineer.
Pipes and water pumps I can do... Vid-unit electronics though...
Let me see...
Sorry Dad. I got the sound, but I can’t get the screen to work.
Here. It just needs a little... finesse...
(FX: CONTROL ADJUSTMENT, SOUND FROM VID-UNIT CLEARS, ROUSING MILITARY MUSIC ACCOMPANIES )
You’re back early. Everything all right?
THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 8
There we are. A perfect picture.
(VIA VID-UNIT) We will return you to the Tower soon. Along with personnel on the Alliance ships stationed on Kalsos have been preparing for this symbolic occasion.
(UNDER FOLLOWING) Alliance Update will be bringing you the whole event live as it happens.

For now, we stay with the admiralty fly-past as the fleet leaves the Kalsos system. Beginning its long trek to the home colonies. Some are days away from port, others still have a journey of weeks or months ahead to the systems of Sentra, Vellarn, Ridious and Pelaxus.
(FX: GOES TO SIT DOWN) Another set of failures. It was pointless even starting that last batch of seedlings...
I could do with some... (COUGHING)
Dad... are you all right?
Some cheering up.
(AT MENTION OF RIDIOUS BY ANNOUNCER) Ridious? That’s us!
First time they’ve mentioned us in months. There’s been nothing about the shortages.
So.. they didn’t take? Again? Even with my soil cleansers?
Nothing. None of the root enhancers worked. I’d pinned my hopes on them...
Look. The war’s over. At last. Surely Earth Admin will send help now?
THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 9
It’s the same the whole system over. There’s a hundred other colonies between Earth and Ridious. Some have had it much worse...
They can’t feed everyone. I only hope they hurry.
You’re pale, Dad. I’1ll get you something to eat. Something warm.
Do we... have anything left?
I’1ll dig into next week’s rations. You can have mine.
It is a special occasion after all.
FX: SPACECRAFT FLYING ON VID-UNIT
THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 10 Scene 4: INT. KALSOS TOWER, UPPER LEVELS
(FX: ECHOING METAL-FLOORED FOYER, TARDIS MATERIALISES, DOORS OPEN)
(OFF, IN TARDIS) This is it, Mel. The Great Tower of Kalsos! Nearly four miles up.
(EMERGING) I do hope it’s not too formal. I’ve no idea about the dress-code on Kalsos? I don’t really have anything that would- (BREAKS OFF, DISAPPOINTED) Oh.
(EMERGING) Are we too early for dinner?
I don’t know what time Kalsos eats dinner, but I’d guess we’re too early for everything. It looks like it’s still being built!
Ah. A little disappointing.
You should have let me drive after all!
FX: MEL TRIES LIFT BUTTONS — NO RESPONSE
The lift’s not working either. Half the buttons are missing...
FX: WALKING ACROSS METAL FLOOR
No windows. I’d have thought there’d be a view. It’d be nice to actually see Kalsos.
(TRYING LIFT CONTROLS) As with most things when you reach this
level of opulence... I’m afraid you have to pay for it! Our tickets would have granted access to the observation gallery. And of course,
the best tables in the restaurant will all have a view. Once they've finished building it...
So. that’s it then? Back to the TARDIS and another rifle through your rainy-day box?
Well... as we’re here.. We could still take a look at that control room... I could see if I can get things running. Take the revolving gallery for a spin perhaps?
THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 11
If you don’t think anyone would mind...
FX: WITH SOME EFFORT, DOCTOR OPENS ACCESS HATCH
Come on. There’s an emergency access running up alongside the lift shaft.
FX: GOING OFF TO LOOK IN HATCH
(RESIGNED) Great.
(CALLING, OFF INSIDE ECHOING TUNNEL) There’s a ladder! Only a couple of floors to the top!
FX: DOCTOR STARTS CLIMBING LADDER, OFF
(FOLLOWING) A ladder? Good job I didn’t wear my little black dress and heels after all.
THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 12
Scene 5: INT. KALSOS TOWER, EMERGENCY SHAFT (CONTINUOUS)
(FX: DOCTOR AND MEL CLIMBING LADDER INSIDE ENCLOSED METAL SHAFT)
Whereas I am dressed for every occasion...
(FOLLOWING) How far is it?
(CLIMBING AND CALLING DOWN) Stop complaining Mel! Nothing like
a workout to build up an appetite.
See! We’re on the next floor already. Let’s take a look in the foyer.
I’ll just get this access hatch open...
FX: PUSHING HATCH OPEN, STEPPING INTO NEXT FLOOR FOYER
(CLIMBING) Wait for me, Doctor.
THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 13
Scene 6: INT. KALSOS TOWER, UPPER LEVELS (CONTINUOUS )
FX: ECHOING METAL-FLOORED FOYER AS BEFORE
Floor four four nine. One more to go.
FX: MEL CLIMBS INTO FOYER FROM HATCH
(WALKING ACROSS FOYER) Hang on. It looks like those cables have been pulled out of the wall.
FX: SHUDDERING BUILDING
What was that?
Ground tremor perhaps? Atmospheric disturbance?
FX: SHUDDERING BUILDING
Surely an earthquake zone isn’t the best place to put the world’s tallest building?
Tell that to the people of Los Angeles.
FX: SHUDDERING BUILDING
It’s getting worse.
Come on. If we go up one more level to the control centre we’1ll get readings on the entire surroundings. (GOING OFF) Once more unto the hatch, dear Mel!
FX: DOCTOR GOES INTO SHAFT AND STARTS CLIMBING AGAIN
If you say so... I’m not actually that hungry now... (CALLING) Doctor! The lift controls here are intact. There’s an intercom...
(OFF) I can see the signs for the control centre! Only a dozen more rungs!
THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 14
FX: PRESSING LIFT BUTTONS
(TO SELF) Maybe the lift is working... it’s just got to come up four hundred floors.
(FX: SHUDDERING CRASH — RENDING OF METAL AND FALLING FLOORS AS SECTION COLLAPSES )
(OFF) Mel!
FX: DUST SETTLES
(CALLING) Doctor! Are you all right?
(OFF, MUFFLED BEHIND BULKHEAD) Mel! I’m fine! What about you? (PAUSE) Mel!
COUGHING, CALLING) Yes Doctor. I- I think so! (PAUSE
(SCRABBLING OVER DEBRIS) The wall’s buckled... The access shaft’s blocked! The bulkhead above has crushed the ladder.
(OFF, MUFFLED BEHIND BULKHEAD) I know... I’m standing on top of it.
(LOOKING DOWN THROUGH METAL SHAFT, ECHOING) But Doctor, I can see all the way down through the hole...
(OFF, MUFFLED BEHIND BULKHEAD) And?
(DOWN SHAFT, ECHOING) The floor below... where we landed... it’s gone! (BEAT) Oh no... the TARDIS!
(FX: HUGE CRASH OF FALLEN METAL AND DEBRIS AT GROUND LEVEL, MILES BELOW)
(OFF, MUFFLED) That must have been her!
THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 15
Scene 7: INT. KALSOS TOWER, UPPER EMERGENCY SHAFT (CONTINUOUS )
FX: SPARKING CABLES, OFF
Evidently the weight was too much for the supports.
(CALLING) Look, I can’t move any of this by myself. I’11 carry on to the top. It’s only a few more steps. I’1ll get to the control centre and see what can be done from there.
(MUFFLED, INDISTINCT) [OK]
Mel?
(MUFFLED, OFF) I said OK Doctor.
I won’t be long!
(MUFFLED, WITH EFFORT, OFF) I... can’t shift this...
(CALLING) Don’t try Melanie! Stay in the centre of the foyer. By the lift. We don’t know what might collapse next.
(MUFFLED, OFF) Just hurry up!
Don’t worry, Mel. I will.
FX: DOCTOR CARRIES ON CLIMBING
THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 16
Scene 8: INT. KALSOS TOWER, EMERGENCY SHAFT
FX: DOCTOR’S CLIMBING, FAINT, GOING OFF
Typical. He invites me out to dinner and we end up ina disaster movie!
FX: ANOTHER SHUDDERING SHAKE — RIGHT OUTSIDE EXTERNAL WALL
(TO SELF) How long have we got before the whole thing comes down, I wonder?
(CALLING) I can see, four, maybe five floors below. (BEAT, TO SELF) I don’t even know if he can hear me...
FX: CRACKING STARTS, SOUND OF DRILL
Oh no. What’s that?
(CALLING) Doctor? Doctor!
FX: DRILL BREAKS THROUGH WALL, AIR RUSHES OUT
(DISTORTED) What the hell...? What are you doing here?
PANTING FOR BREATH
(DISTORTED) Get back!
(PANTING FOR BREATH) I... can’t... breathe...
(DISTORTED) Dammit! I thought you were an echo in the sensor!
(FX: REMOVES VISOR) Here. Take my mouthpiece.
(PANTING FOR BREATH) Thank... thank... you...
(CALLING, FAINT, OFF) Mel! Mel! Can you hear me?
THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 17
Scene 9: INT. KALSOS TOWER, UPPER EMERGENCY SHAFT
FX: SPARKING CABLES, OFF
FX: CRUMBLING RUBBLE AND CRASH OF METAL IN DISTANCE
Oh no... that sounded like another collapse.
(CALLING) Mel! If you can hear me... I’m near the top! I’1l get to the control room! Get things working!
FX: RESUMES CLIMBING LADDER
(TO SELF, CLIMBING) And I should be able to review the structural integrity from there.
There are sparks in those cables... there must be some power somewhere.
(WITH EFFORT) Onwards and upwards!
THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 18
Scene 10: INT. TEVELER HOUSE ON RIDIOUS IV
FX: VID-UNIT MUSIC
FX: FORKS ON PLATES
(VIA VID-UNIT) You’re now seeing the live feed from our Kalsos sat-cams. The Earth Alliance ship Pequod can be seen several miles above the Tower summit, maintaining geostationary orbit.
(UNDER FOLLOWING) The crew have been preparing for weeks. Now a hundred worlds are about to see the fruits of that preparation.
Thank you. I needed that. Here.
Sure you’ve finished? Dad. There’s still some on your plate.
It’s yours by rights Sisrella. I’m full.
(SIGHS) OK.
FX: SISRELLA TAKES PLATES
Look at it. Kalsos Tower. You know the Earth Grand Administrator kept a penthouse suite on the hundredth floor. Never used it.
I’ve only ever known it under the occupation. As a symbol of... Them.
There was a time when it stood for science. Kalsos. A pinnacle of achievement. Quite literally...
(VIA VID-UNIT) Today is an historic day in the war. Today will mark the beginning of the end.
Did you ever visit?
THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 19
Oh no... Kalsos wasn’t for the likes of me. A poor biochemistry graduate.
It was like that when I went to Earth. Nearly forty years ago now.
I know, I know. (REPEATING A CHECKLIST) All the forms... the Restricted Zones... The ‘criminal extravagance’ of the Administration...
Have I told you this story before?
(SMILING) Once or twice.
The last of the agronomist symposiums. The war was just a disturbance in the outer systems. We thought it’d be over ina few years...
(VIA VID-UNIT) We return you to our pictures of the Alliance fleet as it makes its way from the liberated systems.
There was a delegate from the Traban colony... (CHUCKLING) He’d made moonshine from hyper-oxygenated potatoes! Smuggled it in... We had a first night party in the rooms above the Reliquaries...
We were all sick as dogs for the whole conference!
Look at all those Alliance ships. Do you think Barlow’s in one?
Could well be. I’1ll fetch the bottle... (GASPS)
Dad! Let me. (GETTING UP AND GOING TO KITCHEN) I can tell you one thing. You’re taking a day off from the Facility tomorrow.
But the seeds...
THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 20
(CALLING, OFF) You said yourself they were useless. One day won’t make a difference. Not after all this time. You need to keep your strength up.
Three years’ crops blighted. Three harvests lost...
(COMING BACK IN) Stop it, Dad. You can only do so much...
But it’s not.. good... enough.
THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 21
Scene 11: INT. KALSOS TOWER, EMERGENCY SHAFT
(IN BETWEEN BREATHS FROM TUBE) Don’t move. Here. Take a few breaths. Then give me it back.
FX: BARLOW PASSES MOUTHPIECE TO MEL
(IN BETWEEN BREATHS FROM TUBE) Thank you... for the air.
I’m going to have to turn my back on you to fix this hole. If you try anything, both of us are dead. Understood?
(IN BETWEEN TAKING BREATHS FROM MASK) I wouldn’t... I mean. (PASSING TUBE BACK) Here. Go ahead.
(FX: HUMS, SPRAYS AND BANGING OF BARLOW USING VARIOUS TOOLS AND MATERIALS TO SEAL BREACH)
(WORKING ON WALL, TAKING BREATHS) Automatic enviro-control might not kick back in. So when I’ve done this, we’ll have to share my supply. (PASSING TUBE BACK) Your turn.
(TAKING BREATHS FROM TUBE) Thank you... I- I’m sorry.
There. That should hold for long enough for me to work out what to do with you.
Who... who are you?
We'll save the interrogation till later. And I think we can assume I’1ll be the one asking the questions.
Because you’ve got a gun?
That’s how it usually works...
You’re human...
THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 22
You were expecting something... other than human? Who are you here to meet?
No I didn’t mean...
Then again, you don’t look prepared for anything other than...
Dinner. That’s all I was expecting.
Sorry to disappoint, but the kitchen’s closed...
THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 23
Scene 12: INT. KALSOS TOWER, CONTROL ROOM
FX: DOCTOR RACES IN
Right. Kalsos Tower Control room.. Something has to be working.
FX: FLICKING DEAD SWITCHES AND CONTROLS

The air supply systems were still running, so there must be some vestigial power... (CHECKING CONTROLS) Not there... not there... and most definitely not there. (SUDDENLY REALIZING) Wait a minute... Half the control banks are missing...
I was wrong. This building isn’t under construction... These systems have been ripped out! (BEAT) But there’s got to be power somewhere... Ah-ha!
FX: HE OPERATES A CONTROL. FAINT PING OF COMPUTER
(CALM, FAINT) Kalsos Control active.
A vocal interface, no less. Good. Saves time. (TO COMPUTER) Kalsos Control System. Can you hear me?
(CALM, FAINT) Kalsos Control active.
Good. Now. Kalsos Control Computer. This is the Doctor. Can you confirm the status of your power reserves?
Minimal reserves.
Structural integrity?
Tower structure... compromised. (BEAT) The Eminence awaits.
(THROWN) Wh-- What did you say?
(CALM, FAINT) Structural integrity at sixty percent and falling. Insufficient power for detailed analysis. Fifty-five percent. (BEAT) The Eminence awaits.
THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 24
FX: SWITCH OFF
The Em-- ? (TO HIMSELF) No... It can’t be.
FX: OPERATES CONTROLS. BECOMING ACTIVE
(BACK ON THE JOB) Aha, and there’s that vestigial power... If I re-route it to the elevator systems...
FX: SHUDDERING BUILDING
I’m working as fast as I can, Mel.
FX: AIR SUPPLY TURNS ON. DISPLAY BLEEPS.
That’s it! (READING) ‘Supplementary air supply activated’.
(CLEARER) The Eminence has been waiting for you... Doctor.
PAUSE
MUSIC: DARK FOREBODING
(QUIET DREAD) Oh no.
The Eminence is returning-
FX: RIPPING OUT WIRES
No. (WITH GREAT EFFORT, RIPPING WIRES OUT.) Goodbye vocal interface. (QUIET DREAD) It can’t be... It can’t be...
FX: SHUDDERING BUILDING
Pull yourself together, Doctor. Mel needs you. There!
FX: CONTROL OPERATES. FAINT WHIRR OF POWER.
Supplementary air supply. Just enough... Now which floor was she on?
THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 25
Scene 13: INT. KALSOS TOWER, EMERGENCY SHAFT
FX: HISS OF AIR SUPPLY
The air’s back on. Jansen was supposed to have shut off all those systems. Lucky for us he’s lazy.
Right. You still haven’t explained what you’re doing. Or how you got here.
We just came for dinner. We got the date wrong. That’s all.
OK. So I’m not convinced by the ‘why’. Let’s try the ‘how’?
Our ship was on the next floor down... only it collapsed.
They all did. We’re blowing out the internal floor supports before... (BREAKS OFF) You said ‘we’. There are others?
Yes. The [Doctor].
FX: COMMS SIGNAL INTERRUPTS
Wait. (TO COM) Receiving you, Captain.
(FX: DISTORT VIA COM) Teveler. Report.
I can confirm the lifesign is valid. Repeat — it’s not a ghost image. There’s a girl in here. Possibly with others.
There’s only one other.
(D) Copy that Teveler. We’re just running some checks. I’m getting some unusual readings myself. Hold on.
We came here for the opening.
THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 26
You are behind the times aren’t you?
Occupational hazard...
Should have come up with a better story than that. I mean if you really came for the opening, you’re about eighty years too late.
Too late? Then why does everything look half-finished? Who are you and what are you doing here?
Lieutenant Barlow Teveler. Earth Alliance. We’re here to demolish the Tower!
THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 27
Scene 14: INT. TEVELER HOUSE ON RIDIOUS IV
FX: CHINK OF GLASSES
To Barlow.
To Barlow.
FX: SPACESHIPS FLYPAST ON VID-UNIT
(ON VID-UNIT) And we’re going back over to Kalsos now. A few days ago, we had a chat with Captain Trellak. Hero of the Ventos system, and now the officer overseeing the demolition.
(ON VID-UNIT, HELICOPTER-LIKE B/G) We’re placing timed charges along the whole height of the Kalsos tower. We’1ll run the final, manual checks and then detonation can begin.
(ON VID-UNIT) I understand you’ve had to live inside the Tower for the last few weeks.

(ON VID-UNIT, HELICOPTER B/G) We just occupied the lowest levels. We’ve getting ready to blow out the internal floors so that the tower collapses in a predictable and controlled manner when the external charges are set off.
(ON VID-UNIT) Sounds quite a challenge. Any chance it could go wrong?
(ON VID-UNIT, HELICOPTER B/G) None whatsoever. I’ve got my best people on it.
That’1ll be Barlow!
(ON VID-UNIT) So, with demolition scheduled for sixteen-hundred hours Standard Time, we’ll bring you the countdown as soon as it begins.
Stay right here on Alliance Update. All the news you need.
THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 28
FX: NEWS IDENT MUSIC
I saw you had two bottles of this fizz stashed in the cupboard, Dad... A bit extravagant!
I got them last year before they closed the refectory. We can open the other when Barlow comes home.
I’m glad you’ve forgiven him. He will be too.
There’s nothing to forgive. He was doing what he had to. I was... a foolish old man. I was... disappointed. I’d hoped he’d take over the Facility one day...
Well he still could. I’1l just be glad to have him home. And to see that thing blasted to dust.
I don’t know... For all their fuss about it, it’s still only a gesture.
Until we get some help on Ridious, we might as well still be at war.
THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 29
Scene 15: INT. KALSOS TOWER, EMERGENCY SHAFT
FX: COMMS BEEP
(VIA COMMS) It’s not good. Teveler. We’re getting increased activity in the computer core.
Oh no...
What is it? What’s wrong?
Stay back!
(VIA COMMS) What about the Jane Doe?
She looks... normal. No signs of... conversion.
Conversion? Conversion into what? The name’s Mel, by the way. Melanie Bush.
(VIA COMMS) I’m sorry. (BEAT) We’ve got no choice, Barlow. If the Eminence is active...
I understand Captain.
(VIA COMMS) I can give you a few minutes. That’s all. Whatever happens, you’ll have to leave the girl.
If there’s any trace... Any chance the Eminence is still living in the system...
I said I understood Captain. It has to be done.
(VIA COMMS, OFF) Initiating destruct. The broadcast people won’t like it. But frankly they can go hang.
(TO BARLOW) We’re starting the countdown. Good- [luck, lieutenant] (COMMS CUT OFF)
THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 30
Teveler. Over and out.
What ‘has to be done’? What’s this ‘Eminence’ you’re talking about? Why does it scare you so much?
Now I know you must be faking.
I’m not faking. It’s just... hard to explain.
(PREPARING HIS EQUIPMENT) Where’ve you been for the last fifty
years?
Earth is at war.
THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 31
Scene 16: INT. KALSOS TOWER, ELEVATOR
FX: FITFUL ELEVATOR DESCENT, CLANKING
Come on.. Come on! The power phasing I’ve rigged up should get this
lift down to Mel’s floor... And some of the rest of the way...
There must be an intercom. Something linked to the emergency systems...
(FX: BUZZING AND BUTTON PRESSING AS DOCTOR FIDDLES WITH CONTROLS )
Ah-ha! This looks like the broadcast button...
(CALLING INTO COMM) Mel. If you can hear me! Stay in the foyer. I’m coming to get you.
I’m hoping we won’t have to take the stairs to the TARDIS. It’ll be a bumpy ride, but I think the lift can do it.
Just stay put and I’1l be right there.
THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 32
Scene 17: INT. KALSOS TOWER, EMERGENCY SHAFT
FX: HAMMERING AT WALL AGAIN, CRUMBLING DEBRIS
I’m sorry. I’m really, really sorry. I’ve got to open the wall up again.
Is that some sort of... cable? Are you... abseiling down the tower?
I was checking the charges. It wasn’t supposed to blow till late this afternoon.
But you’re going back out... to try to get to the ground?
I won’t have enough time. If it’s any consolation. I don’t think either of us is going to make it.
No. It isn’t really...

(COMING TO A DECISION) Oh... dammit. Come on. Melanie was it? Grab hold of me. I’m almost through the wall. If you can hold your breath for the first couple of miles, I expect you’1l still be awake when we get blown apart by the charges.
Thanks... but I’d rather stay here if it’s all the same to you.
You what?
Please. The Doctor will be able to help. Just let’s find him and we can-
(FX: DISTORT, INTERMITTENT BURBLE OF MESSAGE FROM LIFT INTERCOM) I’1l be right there.
What was that?

TRELLAK: (FX: DISTORT VIA COM) Teveler. Report.
BARLOW: I can confirm the lifesign is valid. Repeat — it’s not a ghost image. There’s a girl in here. Possibly with others.
MEL: There’s only one other.
TRELLAK: (D) Copy that Teveler. We’re just running some checks. I’m getting some unusual readings myself. Hold on.
MEL: We came here for the opening.
DOCTOR WHO: THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 26
BARLOW: You are behind the times aren’t you?
MEL: Occupational hazard...
BARLOW: Should have come up with a better story than that. I mean if you really came for the opening, you’re about eighty years too late.
MEL: Too late? Then why does everything look half-finished? Who are you and what are you doing here?
BARLOW: Lieutenant Barlow Teveler. Earth Alliance. We’re here to demolish the Tower!
DOCTOR WHO: THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 27
DOCTOR WHO: Scene 14: INT. TEVELER HOUSE ON RIDIOUS IV
SISRELLA: To Barlow.
HELGERT: To Barlow.
ANNOUNCER: (ON VID-UNIT) And we’re going back over to Kalsos now. A few days ago, we had a chat with Captain Trellak. Hero of the Ventos system, and now the officer overseeing the demolition.
TRELLAK: (ON VID-UNIT, HELICOPTER-LIKE B/G) We’re placing timed charges along the whole height of the Kalsos tower. We’1ll run the final, manual checks and then detonation can begin.
ANNOUNCER: (ON VID-UNIT) I understand you’ve had to live inside the Tower for the last few weeks.
TRELLAK: (ON VID-UNIT, HELICOPTER B/G) We just occupied the lowest levels. We’ve getting ready to blow out the internal floors so that the tower collapses in a predictable and controlled manner when the external charges are set off.
ANNOUNCER: (ON VID-UNIT) Sounds quite a challenge. Any chance it could go wrong?
TRELLAK: (ON VID-UNIT, HELICOPTER B/G) None whatsoever. I’ve got my best people on it.
SISRELLA: That’1ll be Barlow!
ANNOUNCER: (ON VID-UNIT) So, with demolition scheduled for sixteen-hundred hours Standard Time, we’ll bring you the countdown as soon as it begins.
ANNOUNCER: Stay right here on Alliance Update. All the news you need.
DOCTOR WHO: THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 28
SISRELLA: I saw you had two bottles of this fizz stashed in the cupboard, Dad... A bit extravagant!
HELGERT: I got them last year before they closed the refectory. We can open the other when Barlow comes home.
SISRELLA: I’m glad you’ve forgiven him. He will be too.
HELGERT: There’s nothing to forgive. He was doing what he had to. I was... a foolish old man. I was... disappointed. I’d hoped he’d take over the Facility one day...
SISRELLA: Well he still could. I’1l just be glad to have him home. And to see that thing blasted to dust.
HELGERT: I don’t know... For all their fuss about it, it’s still only a gesture.
HELGERT: Until we get some help on Ridious, we might as well still be at war.
DOCTOR WHO: THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 29
DOCTOR WHO: Scene 15: INT. KALSOS TOWER, EMERGENCY SHAFT
TRELLAK: (VIA COMMS) It’s not good. Teveler. We’re getting increased activity in the computer core.
BARLOW: Oh no...
MEL: What is it? What’s wrong?
BARLOW: Stay back!
TRELLAK: (VIA COMMS) What about the Jane Doe?
BARLOW: She looks... normal. No signs of... conversion.
MEL: Conversion? Conversion into what? The name’s Mel, by the way. Melanie Bush.
TRELLAK: (VIA COMMS) I’m sorry. (BEAT) We’ve got no choice, Barlow. If the Eminence is active...
BARLOW: I understand Captain.
TRELLAK: (VIA COMMS) I can give you a few minutes. That’s all. Whatever happens, you’ll have to leave the girl.
TRELLAK: If there’s any trace... Any chance the Eminence is still living in the system...
BARLOW: I said I understood Captain. It has to be done.
TRELLAK: (VIA COMMS, OFF) Initiating destruct. The broadcast people won’t like it. But frankly they can go hang.
TRELLAK: (TO BARLOW) We’re starting the countdown. Good- [luck, lieutenant] (COMMS CUT OFF)
DOCTOR WHO: THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 30
BARLOW: Teveler. Over and out.
MEL: What ‘has to be done’? What’s this ‘Eminence’ you’re talking about? Why does it scare you so much?
BARLOW: Now I know you must be faking.
MEL: I’m not faking. It’s just... hard to explain.
BARLOW: (PREPARING HIS EQUIPMENT) Where’ve you been for the last fifty
BARLOW: years?
BARLOW: Earth is at war.
DOCTOR WHO: THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 31
DOCTOR WHO: Scene 16: INT. KALSOS TOWER, ELEVATOR
DOCTOR: Come on.. Come on! The power phasing I’ve rigged up should get this
DOCTOR: lift down to Mel’s floor... And some of the rest of the way...
DOCTOR: There must be an intercom. Something linked to the emergency systems...
DOCTOR: (FX: BUZZING AND BUTTON PRESSING AS DOCTOR FIDDLES WITH CONTROLS )
DOCTOR: Ah-ha! This looks like the broadcast button...
DOCTOR: (CALLING INTO COMM) Mel. If you can hear me! Stay in the foyer. I’m coming to get you.
DOCTOR: I’m hoping we won’t have to take the stairs to the TARDIS. It’ll be a bumpy ride, but I think the lift can do it.
DOCTOR: Just stay put and I’1l be right there.
DOCTOR WHO: THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 32
DOCTOR WHO: Scene 17: INT. KALSOS TOWER, EMERGENCY SHAFT
BARLOW: I’m sorry. I’m really, really sorry. I’ve got to open the wall up again.
MEL: Is that some sort of... cable? Are you... abseiling down the tower?
BARLOW: I was checking the charges. It wasn’t supposed to blow till late this afternoon.
MEL: But you’re going back out... to try to get to the ground?
BARLOW: I won’t have enough time. If it’s any consolation. I don’t think either of us is going to make it.
MEL: No. It isn’t really...
BARLOW: (COMING TO A DECISION) Oh... dammit. Come on. Melanie was it? Grab hold of me. I’m almost through the wall. If you can hold your breath for the first couple of miles, I expect you’1l still be awake when we get blown apart by the charges.
MEL: Thanks... but I’d rather stay here if it’s all the same to you.
BARLOW: You what?
MEL: Please. The Doctor will be able to help. Just let’s find him and we can-
DOCTOR: (FX: DISTORT, INTERMITTENT BURBLE OF MESSAGE FROM LIFT INTERCOM) I’1l be right there.
BARLOW: What was that?
DOCTOR WHO: THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 33
MEL: See! It’s working! He’s got the lift working!
MEL: Doctor!
DOCTOR: Going down? (BEAT) And who are you?
BARLOW: They’ve started. Lieutenant Barlow Teveler. Sorry to be the bearer of bad news, but... we’re dead.
DOCTOR WHO: THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 34
DOCTOR WHO: Scene 18: INT. TEVELER HOUSE ON RIDIOUS IV
SISRELLA: Dad! Wake up! something’s happening!
HELGERT: (WAKING UP) Wha- What?
ANNOUNCER: (VIA VID-UNIT) We interrupt our coverage of the flypast to take you back to Kalsos Tower.
HELGERT: (WAKING UP) What is it?
SISRELLA: Look!
ANNOUNCER: (VIA VID-UNIT) We’re being told... Yes... we can confirm... The demolition has been brought forward!
ANNOUNCER: Earth Administration say there is no reason the people should wait any longer to see the final symbol of the Eminence annihilated.
ANNOUNCER: Bowing to the requests of its people watching live throughout the colonies, the Administration has been moved to initiate the destruction as soon as humanly possible.
ANNOUNCER: So. Within minutes now, Kalsos, the last stronghold of the Infinite Warriors, will be no more.
DOCTOR WHO: THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 35
DOCTOR WHO: Scene 19: INT. KALSOS TOWER, ELEVATOR
DOCTOR WHO: (FX: CHARGE EXPLOSIONS BEGIN TO GO OFF, FAR AT FIRST, GETTING CLOSER)
BARLOW: That’s it. We’ve none of us enough time to get out.
DOCTOR: Into the lift, both of you. I can bunnyhop us down, floor by floor.
BARLOW: Even when it’s working, this lift takes twenty minutes to reach the ground. That’s about ten minutes more than this building’s gonna be standing.
MEL: Barlow’s people are here to demolish the Tower, Doctor.
DOCTOR: Ah. We do pick our moments, don’t we Mel?
MEL: Wouldn’t it be quicker just to let it fall? And we all jump as high as we can at the very last minute?
DOCTOR: While that may work for Mister Wile E Coyote, I’m afraid that in the real world, Mel, we have the immutable laws of physics to contend with.
BARLOW: No wait... She’s right.
DOCTOR: What do they teach the military these days?
BARLOW: The bottom three levels are fully functional. We used them as our base of operations when we were setting the charges.
BARLOW: If we let the lift drop.. As soon as it hits the right floor-
DOCTOR: We could use the power down there to put on the brakes?
DOCTOR: Mr Teveler. I like you already.
DOCTOR WHO: THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 36
BARLOW: But...
DOCTOR: Go on.
BARLOW: It would need instant calibration... Send the right signals to the braking control on the third floor before we hit the deck. Align it with the gravity buffers so we don’t get crushed... The calculations... they’d be impossible!
MEL: Barlow? I haven’t introduced you. This is the Doctor... ‘The impossible’ is right up his street.
DOCTOR WHO: THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 37
DOCTOR WHO: Scene 20: INT. TEVELER HOUSE ON RIDIOUS IV
SISRELLA: (COUNTING DOWN WITH SCREEN) Twenty... Nineteen!
ANNOUNCER: (CONTINUING UNDER FOLLOWING) Eighteen... Seventeen .. Sixteen ...
SISRELLA: He’s coming home dad. After all this time... he’s really coming home.
HELGERT: Yes. Yes he is. (SOTTO) But what sort of a home is he coming back to...?
DOCTOR WHO: THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 38
DOCTOR WHO: Scene 21: INT. KALSOS TOWER, ELEVATOR
BARLOW: (SHOUTING) Well, been nice knowing you. Ironic I survive the
BARLOW: last years of the war, just to get blown up by my own charges.
MEL: (SHOUTING) We’re almost there Doctor...
DOCTOR: (SHOUTING) Nobody’s getting blown up, Mr Teveler.. Not if I can help it!
DOCTOR: Keep an eye on those controls Mel. When the counter reaches fifteen I’1l have-
MEL: (SHOUTING) Now Doctor — Do it now!!!
DOCTOR WHO: THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 39
DOCTOR WHO: Scene 22: INT. KALSOS TOWER, GROUND FLOOR (CONTINUOUS )
DOCTOR: Ground floor! Come on!
BARLOW: I don’t believe you did it. This way! I’1ll see if I can raise the ship.
MEL: Right behind you, Barlow.
TRELLAK: (VIA COMMS, DISTORTED) Teveler? Come in Teveler?
BARLOW: Captain... We’re out of the lift. Level zero. We’re heading for the sub-
BARLOW: Not that way then...
DOCTOR: Where now?
BARLOW: (THINKING FAST) There’s another option. Follow me!
BARLOW: (FX: SERIES OF EXPLOSIONS AND COLLAPSING DEBRIS, GETTING CLOSER)
MEL: It’s too late! The whole thing’s coming down!
DOCTOR: Run Mel! Run!
DOCTOR WHO: THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 40
DOCTOR WHO: Scene 23: EXT. KALSOS
DOCTOR WHO: (FX: PUNCTUATED BY TIMED DETONATIONS, WE HEAR THE NEWSREADER BROADCAST IN VOICEOVER)
ANNOUNCER: On the Moons of Thalos.
ANNOUNCER: On Ridious IV.
ANNOUNCER: And Traban Nine.
ANNOUNCER: From Caltaller to Visteon.
ANNOUNCER: And Earth itself.
ANNOUNCER: For every person on every world of the ten systems. They’ve waited fifty-two long years for this day.
ANNOUNCER: This is the day the Infinite Warriors’ stolen fortress is turned to rubble.
ANNOUNCER: This is the day humanity wins! The Tower of Kalsos is no more.
ANNOUNCER: END OF PART ONE
DOCTOR WHO: THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 41

elements.text: PART TWO
Scene 24: INT. TRANSPORT VESSEL, BRIDGE
FX: THE NEWSCAST IS PLAYING, VIA RADIO
You’re listening to Alliance Update. All the news you need.
So, in the days following the destruction of Kalsos Tower, we've seen incredible scenes across the ten systems of the Earth Alliance.
Celebration. Jubilation. But we should spare a thought for those worlds worst affected by five decades of War with the
Eminence and its Infinite Warriors.
The Earth Administration assures its people that help is getting to where it’s needed most.
In a statement this morning, Earth Grand Administrator Walter Vincent said: ‘Hang on in there. We are all in this together.’
Pilot. Turn that off. We’re in range of Ridious IV. Send the
homecoming signal.
Aye captain.
FX: RADIO CLICKS OFF, SOUNDS OF TRANSPORT VESSEL BRIDGE
Still no response to the long range beacon.
(SOTTO) As I thought... (TO PILOT) Begin orbital approach.
FX: ENGINES FIRING
(GETTING UP) Hold her steady on entry. I’1l be in the brig.
FX: TRELLAK CROSSES BRIDGE AND EXITS VIA SWISHING DOOR
(EXITING) All the news you need... (SOTTO, ANGRY) I don’t know how they get away with it...
THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 42
Scene 25: INT. TRANSPORT VESSEL, STCKBAY
FX: FUZZY EXPLOSIONS IN MEL’S HEAD, FADING TO SICKBAY B/G
(FX: FUZZY, FADING INTO FOCUS) (CLOSE) Are you awake? Can you hear me?
D- Doctor?
FX: BEEP OF MEDICAL EQUIPMENT FADES INTO FOCUS
Hello. They said you were coming round. Remember me?
B- Barlow? Where... where am I?
Sickbay. Earth Alliance transport V-K nine alpha. Known to her friends as the Pequod.
What?
My ship. What can I say? The admiral’s got a sense of dramatic irony.
Are we on Kalsos still?
Left there days ago. We’re on our way home. Ridious IV. Home for most of us at any rate.
(WORRIED) I... can’t feel my legs...
A couple of fractures. Completely healed now. The numbness should wear off within the hour.
(REMEMBERING) The Tower! It collapsed on top of us!
THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 43

Don’t worry. We missed the worst of it. Took a good few minutes for the whole thing to fall. I still had access to the security bunkers. You caught a hit from some debris, but we made it, thanks to your friend.
The Doctor! Where is he?
(SHIFTY) Well, you check out as human. He.. didn’t.
What have you done with him?
Captain Trellak wanted... a quiet word...
THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 44
Scene 26: INT. TRANSPORT VESSEL, BRIG
FX: TRELLAK PACING
So. You’re sticking to your story.
As I’ve told your officers, Captain. Again and again. We were there by mistake.
Now kindly untie me and we can discuss this matter ina civilised manner.
By mistake? Quite a wrong turning. To arrive in the enemy’s seat of power. Just as we’re about to destroy it.
We didn’t know.
Then you’re the only two people in the ten systems who didn’t. Every channel’s been covering it for weeks.
I’m not a great one for watching television...
No... You like playing with computers, don’t you? How did you manage to revive the Eminence?
Believe me. The very last thing I’d do is offer any assistance to the Eminence.
What did you do with that control system on Kalsos? We thought it was dead.
I was trying to help my friend. All I did was make a few connections... (REALISING, TO HIMSELF) Ah, yes... a connection.
We'd ripped them out just to make sure... but the systems had been down for weeks. Ever since the Infinite Warriors began their retreat.
THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 45
Retreat? (SOTTO) I didn’t think that word was in the Eminence’s vocabulary...
So there were no enemy forces left on Kalsos?
Only if you count the sightseers.. The Fleet had to keep them at bay. There’s a cordon round the whole system now. Nothing in or out.
Which begs another question. How did you get in undetected?
My Ship has a.. particular talent for it.
So. What’ve we got?
A stealth ship.
Plus the fact you re-activated the last known refuge of the Eminence.
And added to that, I’m getting garbled reports of a ‘Doctor’ assisting the Infinite Warriors on Delafoss.
Doesn’t stack up too well for you, ‘Doctor’.
When you hear the full story from Delafoss you may think differently...
(CONSIDERING) But then... You did get my man out.
(ANNOYED) Oh... I don’t have time for this. I’ve an exhausted crew who just want to get home. And frankly. So do I. (GETS UP)
FX: TRELLAK CROSSES CELL AND UNLOCKS DOOR
Keep him secured. The Administration can decide what to do with him once we get to Ridious.
Captain! One question. You say the Eminence is gone... How was it defeated?
THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 46
‘Defeated’.. That’s one word for it.
You should watch the newscasts, Doctor. According to them, the Infinite Warriors were obliterated.
By us.
THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 47
Scene 27: EXT. DELIKUR SPACEPORT
FX: CROWDS MILLING, GETTING RESTLESS
(APPROACHING THROUGH CROWD, CALLING) This one’s full as well. Sorry dad. Looks like everyone got to the hostels before us. (WORRIED) Dad?
(WAKING FROM EXHAUSTED DOZE) Sis-Sisrella.. Oh... I’m sorry my
dear. After coming all this way... I couldn’t keep my eyes [open]
(INTERRUPTING) Our supplies? Where are the ration-packs, Dad?
That boy, over there! (GETTING TO HIS FEET) I’11 get him...
No, Dad! (CALLING) Please! Stop him, someone!
FX: HELGERT RUNS AFTER BOY, A STRUGGLE
Give me that back, you young- (PUSHED TO GROUND) Urggh!
(ARRIVING) Dad! (TO THIEF) Leave him alone.
FX: MORE SCUFFLING, THIEF OBJECTS 'Oi! Geroff! I wasn't doing nuffin!'
(GRABBING THIEF) Back off! Don’t you know Professor Teveler when you see him? It’s thanks to him we’ve got any food at all.
Get away with you. (FX: THIEF RUNS OFF ‘Only tryin' to eat...')
Elkinar! What are you doing here?
My people told me you’d been seen down here. Come to welcome home the conquering hero?
(SCOFFING) Your ‘people’? Who do you think you are? King of the looters?
THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 48
(HANDING RATIONS BACK) Professor. Your rations.
(SCOLDING) Dad! (TO ELKINAR) Thanks, Elkinar. Barlow’s on the next ship. You should meet up when... (THINKS BETTER OF IT) Thank you. That boy nearly had all our supplies for the week.
You’re not out on your farm now, Professor. You can’t wave your ration packs about on the mean streets of Delikur. That’s just asking for trouble.
(GRUDGING) Thank you. Making yourself useful in the City, Elkinar? I’d heard about your rabble-rousing.
Yeah. Funny you never see us on the news though.
Is that what you want? To be a famous... troublemaker? Instead of an anonymous researcher who actually makes a difference?
(WARNING) Dad.
I’m just trying to look out for people. (BEAT) Sisrella. It’s... good to see you again. So Barlow’s coming back is he?
Yes. We were looking for somewhere to stay the night. But the hostels are full. And the hotels over by the Spaceport are too expensive.
Look. It’s not much. But we’ve set up a camp under the access ramp to the transrider parks. It’s covered at least.
Thanks Elkinar. When Barlow gets here... I- we could...
Don’t worry Sisrella. We just lost touch, your brother and me. He wanted to be a soldier.
At least he’s been doing something useful.
THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 49
Maybe I should have gone to war. Maybe we all should. At least we’d have got a decent meal every day.
He was on the front when we took back the Ventos system. I think he’s earned every grain. Don’t you?
Look. If you want to try it, the camp’s back that way.
(GOING OFF) Might catch you later. Oh, and Sisrella. I'd... stay away from the spaceport gates tonight.
What’s he up to? Stirring up more trouble, no doubt. I don’t know what you ever saw in him. He just-
(INTERRUPTING) No, Dad. Look at the deprivation here. It’s worse than we thought. (BEAT) You can’t blame Elkinar.
Maybe not. But I can still dislike the fellow.
THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 50
Scene 28: INT. TRANSPORT VESSEL, OUTSIDE CAPTAIN’S QUARTERS
FX: MEL AND BARLOW WALK ALONG CORRIDOR
CORRIDOR OUTSIDE
(WALKING) Just let me do the talking. The Captain needs careful
handling.
(WALKING) All I want is to see the Doctor. Make sure he’s all right. Surely your Captain can’t refuse that? Is this her cabin? The one with the guard?
Trooper.
Sir!
FX: COMMS BEEP
(VIA COM) Who is it?
(TO INTERCOM) Teveler, ma’am. And the... civilian.
(VIA COM) Come.
FX: DOOR SWISHES OPEN THEN CLOSES BEHIND BARLOW AND MEL
THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 51
Scene 29: INT. TRANSPORT VESSEL, CAPTAIN’S QUARTERS
CONTINUOUS
FX: SOOTHING MUSIC B/G
FX: MEL STOMPS IN
(STORMING IN) Captain Trellak? Why are you keeping the Doctor locked up? He’s not some common criminal you know.
What would you call a collaborator?
That’s nonsense. He saved me and he saved Barlow here. The Doctor would never collaborate with anyone against the Earth Alliance, or whatever it is you call yourselves.
You might be the Captain here. But you’ve got everything just about as wrong as you can get it.
Mel! Sorry, Captain. I did ask...
Lieutenant. Give me a moment.
FX SHUTS OFF B/G MUSIC
(BEAT) Now. Young woman.
I'm Mel. Mel Bush
Miss Bush. Frankly, you’ve got Barlow to thank that you’re not in the brig yourself. So you’d be well advised to listen to him.
The fact remains that your friend — this... Doctor - has been in contact with the Eminence. We were tracking the Computer logs in the Kalsos Tower right up to the end.
You all keep talking about this Eminence. I’ve never heard of ieee
THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 52
I can’t quite believe that, Miss Bush.
I think she’s telling the truth ma’am. Perhaps they’re from an outer colony?
You’ve never heard of the Infinite Warriors? The Breath of Forever?
No. None of it, Captain. This ‘Eminence’, or whatever it is... it’s got nothing to do with me. Or the Doctor.
FX: DOOR CONTROL
(CALLING) Trooper. Take Miss Bush outside for a moment.
Ma’am!
But I haven’t finished-
You've said all you need to. I just want a word with Barlow and then I’1l send you to see your precious Doctor.
(SURPRISED) Thank you, Captain... I-
Now get out before I change my mind.
FX: DOOR CLOSES
You're... letting her see him, Ma’am?
Yes. Well. We’ve got nothing out of him. Keep them under observation. See if they give us anything more when they’re together.
Aye, Captain. Though I’m starting to think they really have come from somewhere else...
THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 53
Well. Let’s find out. (BEAT) Oh, and Lieutenant.
Ma’am?
Keep them both in your sights. Any sign of... transformation. You know what to do.
THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 54
Scene 30: EXT. TUNNEL OUTSIDE DELIKUR SPACEPORT
(FX: CROWDS, OFF. SISRELLA AND HELGERT LAYING OUT SLEEPING BAGS)
Not the height of luxury. But at least the ground’s level.
If a little hard on the bones...
Here. I’1l put my coat under you...
Don’t fuss Sisrella!
(OFF, CALLING TO CROWD) Look! The lights in the sky! We can see the transports coming in! What do you think the soldiers have been living on all this time? Fresh air?
[ (UNDER FOLLOWING) Come on. Gather round. You might be interested in what I’ve got to say.
This time we can do something. This time we can actually take control of our lives...]
(SIGHS) If we’ve got that racket going on we’re neither of us going to sleep.
It’s Elkinar... What’s he saying?
Some nonsense about ‘exploitation of the masses’ again, no doubt.
No.. he’s planning something. He told us to stay away from the spaceport gates...
I wonder what your brother will think when he gets here and sees this... chaos?
(OFF, SPEAKING TO CROWD) Those military transports up there are all packed with supplies!
That’s food that could feed us! Feed our families! Why should
i ' ? ! BSR WAP SUBSE MG YEohAGsPLenty? For years!
Page 55 (FX: ANGRY CROWD) [It’s not fair! We want our share! Shame! ]
FX: WE SHIFT FOCUS TO OUTSIDE, WHERE ELKINAR IS SPEAKING TO CROWD

(OFF, SPEAKING TO CROWD) Every penny you’ve ever paid to Earth Administration. It’s all gone towards the war. And it’s not just your income taxes. Every journey you make. Every grain of rice you buy. There’s a levy that goes straight into the war- chest of Earth Administration.

Into the hands of Walter Vincent. He’s down there on Earth, light years away, in his tropical mansion. You think he knows where his next meal’s coming from? Damn right he does. Straight out of our pockets!
You heard him this morning! We’re all in this together!
FX: JEERING CROWD
You bought every last gram of the army’s supplies with your hard earned credits.
So let’s go and collect what we’ve paid for!
(FX: CHEERING) [Yeah! Let’s do it! Come on! Let’s go!]
(FX: DURING THE CROWD'S CHEERS, WE SHIFT FOCUS BACK INTO THE TUNNEL TO SISRELLA AND HELGERT. ONCE MORE ELKINAR'S SPEECH IS HEARD 'OFF'.)
(OFF) I need some volunteers. We’ve got the key-codes for a short- range shuttle.
I’ve a pilot and twenty spaces on board for those who want to take back what they’re owed!
We just need to get through this fence.
Listen, Dad. Did you hear what he said?
All I can hear is my stomach rumbling.
THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 56
Scene 31: INT. TRANSPORT VESSEL, BRIG
FX: SECURITY DOOR OPENING
(RUSHING IN) Doctor!
(RELIEVED) Mel. You’re safe.
I'd... get up and offer you my seat. But as you can see, I’ma little tied up.
You shouldn’t be treating him like this. Let him go!
I take it that you engineered this meeting... Lieutenant Engineer
Teveler? Thank you.
Thank the Captain. You’ve got five minutes.
FX: WALKING TO DOOR
Trooper, with me.
FX: BARLOW AND GUARD EXIT AND CELL DOOR IS LOCKED
So.. Another fine mess. I’m sorry, Mel...
It’s not your fault Doctor. Apparently we’ll be landing soon and we can sort this out with someone in authority.
Let’s hope so. How are you feeling, after that building fell on
you?
A bit groggy when I woke up. But now I feel good as new.

ELKINAR: (FX: DURING THE CROWD'S CHEERS, WE SHIFT FOCUS BACK INTO THE TUNNEL TO SISRELLA AND HELGERT. ONCE MORE ELKINAR'S SPEECH IS HEARD 'OFF'.)
ELKINAR: (OFF) I need some volunteers. We’ve got the key-codes for a short- range shuttle.
ELKINAR: I’ve a pilot and twenty spaces on board for those who want to take back what they’re owed!
ELKINAR: We just need to get through this fence.
SISRELLA: Listen, Dad. Did you hear what he said?
HELGERT: All I can hear is my stomach rumbling.
DOCTOR WHO: THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 56
DOCTOR WHO: Scene 31: INT. TRANSPORT VESSEL, BRIG
MEL: (RUSHING IN) Doctor!
DOCTOR: (RELIEVED) Mel. You’re safe.
DOCTOR: I'd... get up and offer you my seat. But as you can see, I’ma little tied up.
MEL: You shouldn’t be treating him like this. Let him go!
DOCTOR: I take it that you engineered this meeting... Lieutenant Engineer
DOCTOR: Teveler? Thank you.
BARLOW: Thank the Captain. You’ve got five minutes.
BARLOW: Trooper, with me.
DOCTOR: So.. Another fine mess. I’m sorry, Mel...
MEL: It’s not your fault Doctor. Apparently we’ll be landing soon and we can sort this out with someone in authority.
DOCTOR: Let’s hope so. How are you feeling, after that building fell on
DOCTOR: you?
MEL: A bit groggy when I woke up. But now I feel good as new.
MEL: Barlow said my leg was broken. But I’d never know it. Space medicine, eh?
MEL: What about you?
DOCTOR WHO: THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 57
DOCTOR: I’m in one piece. No ‘space medicine’ required. A few bruises, that was all. We've... been on this ship for days, you know.
MEL: Yes. Barlow told me. You’ve been kept in here all that time?
DOCTOR: (SHIFTING UNCOMFORTABLY) Unfortunately, yes. It’s doing nothing for my posture...
DOCTOR: Your friend, Barlow. What else did he tell you?
MEL: The Earth forces have just come out of some fifty-year war.
DOCTOR: So I gather. With the Infinite Warriors and their slave armies. It’s not like ‘the Eminence’ to simply disappear...
MEL: (SURPRISED) Oh. So you do know about it? I didn’t think you’d- [ever encountered it before. ]
DOCTOR: (INTERRUPTING) The TARDIS. It must be back on Kalsos. Buried under tonnes of rubble.
MEL: What is this ‘Eminence’. What happened when you met it before?
DOCTOR: Mel. Please. (CLOSE, WHISPER) Don’t ask me any more. Walls have ears.
MEL: (WHISPER) Ah. The glass... It’s an observation window.
DOCTOR: Indeed. Our priority now is to contact someone in authority and find a way back to the TARDIS.
DOCTOR WHO: THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 58
DOCTOR WHO: Scene 32: EXT. OUTSIDE DELIKUR SPACEPORT
DOCTOR WHO: (FX: CROWDS BREAKING DOWN FENCES. SISRELLA AND HELGERT ARE WATCHING FROM A DISTANCE)
ELKINAR: (OFF) Who’s with me? You men. Bring your weapons. They might need some persuasion!
ELKINAR: (GOING FURTHER OFF) Let’s take back what’s ours! (DISTANT) Come on. To the gates!
SISRELLA: He’s actually doing it. They’re storming the spaceport
SISRELLA: barriers.
SISRELLA: (FX: DISTANT CRASHES OF FENCES BEING BROKEN OPEN, SOUND OF CROWD GOES OFF)
HELGERT: Look at them. Idiots. They can’t all get on board.
SISRELLA: Oh my God. Where are the security people? Where are the guards? It’s just mayhem down there.
HELGERT: Then the sooner Barlow’s people get here, the better.
HELGERT: With any luck those fools are going to kill themselves taking off.
SISRELLA: Dad! You don’t mean that.
HELGERT: Of course not... But.. they’re just making it worse for everyone.
HELGERT: If Elkinar expended half the energy on research that he’s doing here... He had the makings of a good biologist once.
SISRELLA: What will happen if they do make it up there..? Up to the Alliance ships?
DOCTOR WHO: THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 59
HELGERT: Barlow’s unit has spent the last few years up against the Infinite Warriors. I don’t think Elkinar’s band of chancers will pose much of a threat.
SISRELLA: Well, they made it out of the landing bay...
HELGERT: They’1l be back with their tail between their legs by morning. At least we might be able to get some rest now...
SISRELLA: You sleep, Dad. You need it.
SISRELLA: (SOTTO) But I don’t think I should risk it... Not if we want to wake up in one piece...
DOCTOR WHO: THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 60
DOCTOR WHO: Scene 33: INT. TRANSPORT VESSEL, BRIG
BARLOW: Right, you two. Time’s up.
DOCTOR: Remember what I said, Mel. Stay calm. (TO BARLOW) Treat her well Lieutenant.
BARLOW: We’re not savages.
DOCTOR: But you are eavesdroppers. Have you and your Captain learned anything of interest?
BARLOW: You can forget going back to Kalsos, if that’s what you’re planning.
MEL: But you know we have to! We’ve got to find a way back somehow.
BARLOW: And if you keep asking when we get to Ridious, they’re going to want to know why...
MEL: We've told you why. To get to our ship.
BARLOW: If it really was in that Tower, it won’t be much use to you now.
DOCTOR: My TARDIS has survived worse...
BARLOW: Look. We’1ll hand you over to the colony authorities on Ridious IV. They’1ll check everything out.
MEL: Good. Then we’1ll soon be on our way out of this madness.
BARLOW: I wouldn’t get your hopes up. At the moment the Captain has you pegged as Eminence spies.
DOCTOR WHO: THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 61
DOCTOR: You know as well as I do, Lieutenant. The Eminence doesn’t need spies. It just occupies the mind of those it chooses.
DOCTOR: Look at me.
DOCTOR: (GETTING ANGRY) Is my skin cracked and grey? Are my eyes aglow with fire? Do I speak with the ‘voice of death’?
DOCTOR: (ADAMANT, CONVINCING HIMSELF AS MUCH AS THE OTHERS) No! I am not under the influence of the Eminence and never will be!
MEL: (TAKEN ABACK) Doctor... It’s all right. You believe him, don’t you Barlow?
BARLOW: It’s true. I’ve seen the effect of the Breath of Forever.
MEL: Can you tell me what it is? This Eminence?
BARLOW: Nobody knows. Not really. We just saw what it could do.
DOCTOR: A gaseous intelligence. Capable of transporting itself across the galaxy housed inside teleportation caskets.
BARLOW: Whenever the Infinite Warriors extended their front. The Eminence would send another casket. Force its slaves to breathe in the Breath of Forever.
DOCTOR: An orange mist containing the essence of the Eminence. Anyone who breathes it in is.. transformed... into an Infinite Warrior.
MEL: A what?
DOCTOR: An invincible walking cadaver. All memory of its human life is gone. The skin calcifies. An orange energy burns from within... Through the eyes, through the cracks in the skin...
MEL: That’s horrible...
DOCTOR WHO: THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 62
BARLOW: So, you do know.. The Eminence seemed unstoppable. Until... it stopped...
MEL: How did you manage to beat them?
BARLOW: We... didn’t. Four months ago, the Eminence armies began pulling back. Retreating. We’d find ghost ships full of the bodies of slave warriors. Dead. Abandoned. They withdrew all the way-
DOCTOR: To Kalsos.
BARLOW: So you see why it’s probably a bad idea to try and get there.
MEL: I think I’m beginning to. So Doctor, what’s our next move?
BARLOW: Now, what’s that?
DOCTOR: Oooh... trouble.
DOCTOR WHO: THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 63
DOCTOR WHO: Scene 34: INT. TRANSPORT VESSEL, CAPTAIN’S QUARTERS
TRELLAK: Report, Pilot!
PILOT: (VIA COM) You’d better get up here ma’am.
TRELLAK: And what the hell was that?
PILOT: (VIA COM) That civilian shuttle we were tracking... It’s docking.
TRELLAK: (EXITING CABIN) Docking? I gave no authority...
DOCTOR WHO: THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 64
DOCTOR WHO: Scene 35: INT. TRANSPORT VESSEL, CORRIDOR (CONTINUOUS )
TRELLAK: Trooper. With me.
PILOT: (VIA COM) They didn’t ask for any, Ma’am.
TRELLAK: (RUNNING) Do what you can to hold her steady pilot. I’m on my way.
PILOT: (VIA COM) They’re locked on, Captain. They’re blasting the hull
PILOT: doors open into storage.
TRELLAK: Change of plan. Get a security detail down to the bays. I’1l meet them there.
TRELLAK: Lieutenant Teveler?
BARLOW: (VIA COM) Captain? What’s happening?
TRELLAK: (RUNNING) Trouble near the brig. Get the prisoners clear. There’s a chance of a hull breach.
BARLOW: (VIA COM) Are we under attack?
TRELLAK: Not exactly. Keep the Trooper with you. Don’t let the Doctor
TRELLAK: and Miss Bush out of your sight.
TRELLAK: I’m on my way.
DOCTOR WHO: THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 65
DOCTOR WHO: Scene 36: INT. TRANSPORT VESSEL, CORRIDOR
DOCTOR WHO: (FX: SHIP’S ALERT CONTINUOUS, RUNNING FEET, A SINGLE BLASTER SHOT, CRY OF PAIN)
ELKINAR: (OFF) Men with guns. It’s always the men with guns who get
ELKINAR: their way.
MEL: (RUNNING) Sounds like someone’s hurt.
DOCTOR: (RUNNING) That tends to happen when the guns come out, Mel.
ELKINAR: (OFF) We’re here for the food! Don’t try to stop us!
BARLOW: (STOPPING) I know that voice... Stay here you two. Don’t move. Trooper, with me. Ready your weapon. But hold your fire!
BARLOW: (SHOUTING) All of you. Hold your fire! You men get back!
BARLOW: (ROUNDING CORNER, GROAN OF RECOGNITION) Elkinar. I might have known it’d be you.
TRELLAK: (ARRIVING) Lieutenant. Report. What’s happened here?
BARLOW: Just got here myself, Ma’am.
ELKINAR: Your trigger-happy friends have shot one of my people, Barlow.
TRELLAK: You know this person, Lieutenant?
BARLOW: He worked with my father on the food programs. Thought he was too good for it though.
DOCTOR WHO: THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 66
ELKINAR: I decided it was time to do something practical.
TRELLAK: Like raiding my ship? Some homecoming this is.
BARLOW: I didn’t think yours would be the first familiar face I'd see, Elkinar. And definitely not before I reached solid ground.
TRELLAK: Keep them covered. Stay where you are. The lot of you.
DOCTOR: (APPROACHING) Look at them, Captain.
MEL: They’re all so thin.
BARLOW: I told you two to stay back!
ELKINAR: (CALLING) Looks like you keep your passengers well-fed too!
TRELLAK: (CLOSE) Your assessment Teveler?
BARLOW: We know they’re human at least. An Infinite Warrior wouldn’t even notice an injury.
MEL: They can barely hold their weapons.
DOCTOR: Look at their faces Captain. They’re scared. Desperate.
TRELLAK: (ANNOYED) When I want the opinion of my prisoners, I’1l1 ask for it. Lieutenant. Take our guests to a more secure area.
ELKINAR: No witnesses. That’d suit you wouldn’t it, Captain?
MEL: We’re not leaving. Not until we know what you’re going to do to these people.
DOCTOR WHO: THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 67
TRELLAK: I haven’t spent ten years at war just so we could shoot the people we’ve been protecting.
TRELLAK: (BEAT) Open up the supply hold. Let them take what they need.
ELKINAR: You heard her, soldiers. Give us what we came for.
DOCTOR: An admirable gesture, Captain. But you can’t feed the whole planet.
TRELLAK: Then I’11 do what I can. The war’s over, Doctor. We’ve already lost millions.
BARLOW: Mel’s right. They can hardly carry those weapons, let alone fire them. Elkinar only got them up here through force of will.
DOCTOR: Yes. It’s incredible what can be achieved through force of will...
TRELLAK: (CALLING) You man. Elkinar, is it? Get your people back to your ship with the supplies.
ELKINAR: I don’t take orders from you.
TRELLAK: Then think of it as a suggestion. Tell your pilot he’1ll have to undock that ship of yours if we’re all going to make planetfall in one piece.
ELKINAR: We’ll go when we’re ready. Look, there’s another store through here!
TRELLAK: (CALLING OVER NOISE) Sergeant. Help them get the rations back to their vessel. Take the injured man to sickbay.
TRELLAK: Teveler. Talk to your friend, will you? Get him to see sense.
DOCTOR WHO: THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 68
BARLOW: Aye Captain. (SOTTO) Though sense was never his strong point.
TRELLAK: And the prisoners... we’d better- (BREAKS OFF, BEAT) Where’ve
TRELLAK: they gone?
DOCTOR WHO: THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 69
DOCTOR WHO: Scene 37: INT. TRANSPORT VESSEL, ANOTHER CORRIDOR
DOCTOR WHO: (FX: RUNNNING FOOTSTEPS ALONG CORRIDOR AMID JUBILANT COLONISTS CARRYING SUPPLIES)
DOCTOR: (RUNNING) Come on Mel. The colonists’ shuttle must be through here.
MEL: (RUNNING) It’s chaos, Doctor.
DOCTOR: (STOPPING) Then the least I can do is make sure we don’t end up in a shipwreck.
MEL: At least they’ve got food now.
DOCTOR: Much good it will do them... Oh, why can’t they see!
MEL: What is it?
DOCTOR: This is all part of its plan.
MEL: What plan? You mean... the Eminence.
DOCTOR: Let the human race think they’ve won.
DOCTOR: Chamberlain got a lot of things wrong, but he was right about one thing. ‘In war, whichever side may call itself the victor, there are no winners...’
DOCTOR: (ANGRY) With all your experience of wars, planetary and interplanetary, you humans really should know by now.
MEL: Hang on, Doctor. It’s not my fault!
DOCTOR: I’m sorry, Mel. I don’t mean to take it out on you. It’s frustrating that they’re ignoring the obvious.
MEL: Go on then. Enlighten me.
DOCTOR WHO: THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 70
DOCTOR: The Captain herself said as much. The Infinite Warriors have not been defeated. That wasn’t a retreat.
MEL: What was it then? A... tactical withdrawal?
DOCTOR: Look at what’s happening here, Mel. Deprivation. Starvation. This chaos is being replayed on hundreds of colony worlds.
DOCTOR: It must be even worse where the Infinite Warriors had control.
MEL: So... The colonies have just fallen into anarchy.
DOCTOR: No food. No resources. Only a communication network spreading propaganda, while the Administration sits safely back on Earth. The Eminence knows what it’s doing all right.
DOCTOR: A few more months and the human race will be on its knees.
MEL: And you think the Eminence, with its... Infinite Warriors... You think it’s coming back?
DOCTOR: Oh, Mel... I’m sure of it.
DOCTOR WHO: THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 71
DOCTOR WHO: Scene 38: INT. EMINENCE MIND
EMINENCE: You are sure Doctor... because you know.
EMINENCE: You were a fool ever to think we could be banished from your consciousness.
EMINENCE: You see, Doctor... You know our plan because... we are already there.
EMINENCE: The Eminence is already inside your mind.
EMINENCE: END OF PART TWO
DOCTOR WHO: THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 72

elements.text: PART THREE
Scene 39: INT. DELIKUR SPACEPORT
FX: CROWD CELEBRATING
FX: RADIO PLAYS NEWS IDENT
(VIA RADIO) Our troops are coming home. After long years away, we finally see the boys and girls of the Alliance Fleet
returning to the arms of their families.
Grand Administrator Walter Vincent said we should all take a moment to remember those we have lost.

Then tighten our belts. And get back to work. There will be some tough times ahead, but we are all in it together. And we should remember this above all else: the Eminence is defeated. Humanity has won.
There are reports of jubilant crowds on Ridious IV taking a shuttle to greet the homecoming troops.
In scenes repeated out across the systems, families are celebrating. We’ll be bringing you more pictures later.
This is Alliance Update. All the news you need.
THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 73
Scene 40: INT. TRANSPORT VESSEL, BRIDGE
FX: SHIP ENGINES DECELERATING
Coming in to land, Captain. Delikur Spaceport, Ridious IV.
CHEERING
(TO CREW) All right, people. Remember where you are.
Let them enjoy it, Lieutenant. God knows the next few years are going to be hard. Even Earth Admin admits that.
Your father’s been working on a way out of this, I believe?
Seeing the state of the others, I... I just hope he’s still alive.
(BEAT) I’m sorry, Captain... about the girl. And the Doctor. I’ve got men searching.
It couldn’t be helped... given the situation. If they’re not on board, they must be on that shuttle with our would-be hijackers.
We've tracked its landing course. I’ve tried radioing ahead, but I can’t raise spaceport security.
Yes.. I’d noticed that. I’m beginning to think that in the great scheme of things, any threat the Doctor poses might be the least of our worries...
I’m getting nothing on the secure channels to the Governor's office either.
(SOTTO) I didn’t tell you this, Teveler, but the word from fleet command is he’s gone to ground.
You mean...?
THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 74
People on the edge of starvation. Infrastructure gone. No authorities worth a damn. Far as I can see, Ridious IV is on the verge of collapse.
God help whoever ends up running it...
THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 75
Scene 41: INT. HIJACKED FLIER, FLIGHT DECK
FX: ENGINES POWERING DOWN AFTER LANDING
There, down safely. The troop ship’s about five minutes behind.
(CALLING TO CREW) Right, let’s get those containers stacked and ready to move out.
You’re lucky the Doctor was here. If your landing skills are anything like your docking manoeuvres, we’d have been splattered across that car park over there.
Thank you. ‘Doctor’, is it?
Yes, Elkinar.
I’m a doctor too you know. Biochemistry and applied xeno- agronomy. Doctor Elkinar Dajan.
Then you should have known better. You could have just waited till the Pequod landed, you know. There was no need to go storming aboard.
I’m not a soldier. It just got to the point where... something had to be done.
But not necessarily this.
Captain Trellak is an honourable officer. She proved that by the way she handled the situation.
Barlow is too. They’d have been happy to give you their supplies without you taking them.
Barlow Teveler... Chalked up another member of his fan-club, I see. In my experience, you never know with Earth Alliance. Whether they’1l do what they say.
THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 76
(STANDING AND WALKING TO OTHER CREW) Right, you lot.
(FX: SHUTTLE DOORS OPENING, SYSTEMS SWITCHED OFF, ELKINAR’S CREW PASSING BY)
Bring the supplies out. Keep the weapons handy. We might get rushed.
(FX: MEL AND DOCTOR GOING DOWN METAL GANGPLANK INTO CHAOTIC SPACEPORT )
So where are we now, Doctor?
Ridious IV. A colony in the seventh system. And fortunately we’re at a spaceport. We need a ship fit for a much longer haul...
Where are you headed?
Our own transport’s back on Kalsos.
Good luck with that. You won’t get anywhere near Kalsos without a military escort.
(RUNNING OFF) Hey! You lot! Don’t let those crates out of your sight!
What are you thinking Doctor?
That it’s bedlam here. And it’s only going to get worse.
THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 77
Scene 42: EXT. DELIKUR SPACEPORT, EXIT RAMP
(FX: EXCITED CROWD, MILITARY TRANSPORT DOOR CLAMPS UNLOCKING, OFF)
That damn fool Elkinar. He could have killed them all!
He never did think things through. Barlow’s ship’s down safe. That’s the main thing. Look. They’ve lowered the gangplank. The
soldiers are coming out!
(CROWD MORE EXCITED GREETING SOLDIERS, CALLS ‘Over here! Welcome back! Thank you!’ )
Can you see him? Is he there?
(SEARCHING CROWD) No... Wait... (SPOTS HIM) Barlow! Barlow! Over
here!
(CALLING, FAR OFF) Sis! Sis! Dad!?
FX: RUNNING FEET, PUSHING THROUGH CROWD
Oh Barlow. We missed you! We missed you so much.
HUGS HIM
It’s only been five years, Sis. You’ve grown!
BEAT
(MORE WARY) Dad... I-
You did what you had to do. I know that now. I’m... proud of you son.
(BEAT) Come here! Give your old dad a hug.
THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 78
Scene 43: EXT. DELIKUR SPACEPORT, NOT FAR OFF
FX: CROWDS, AS BEFORE
Look Mel. There’s your friend Barlow.
That must be his family... Oh, Doctor. That poor old man can hardly stand.
And the girl doesn’t look much stronger.
Look around, Mel. The people here. They’re even thinner than the ones who stormed the ship.
The whole colony must have been starving for months.
We’re going to need help to get to a ship. And Barlow’s the only friendly face we know here.
We shouldn’t do anything to draw attention to ourselves...
He listened to us before... (GOING OFF TOWARDS BARLOW’S FAMILY) If we explain properly. Everything you’ve worked out about the Eminence... he might be willing to help.
Mel! Wait!
THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 79
Scene 44: EXT. DELIKUR SPACEPORT, EXIT RAMP (CONTINUOUS)
FX: CROWDS, AS BEFORE
(CALLING) Barlow.
Mel? And the Doctor. So. You didn’t run very far then.
We’ve got nothing to run away from.
Still looking to get back to Kalsos are you?
Very much so.
(COMING UP) Who are these people?
I’m Mel, and this is--
--the Doctor. Thank you, Mel.
This is my father, Professor Helgert Teveler, And my sister Sisrella.
(ARRIVING) Hi. Were you with my brother on the Pequod? You don’t look like soldiers.
That’s because we’re not.
No. We're... civilians. Barlow saved us when the Kalsos Tower collapsed.
Kalsos Tower? We watched it on the vid. You mean you were in there when it-
Sis. Take this credit stick, And my I.D. Go get us a transrider from the park. I'll take us home in style.
THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 80
The perks of the military! (GOING OFF) OK. I’1ll have them send it to the gates.
Barlow... we owe you our lives.
(CONSIDERING) By rights, I should hand you two straight over to the authorities.
(SNORTS) You’1ll be lucky if you can find them. The Ridious Governor holed himself up in his bunker eighteen months ago. No-one’s seen hide nor hair of him since.
And in the meantime, it looks like mob-rule’s taken over...
Are these people... dangerous, Barlow?
(CONSIDERING AND MAKING A DECISION) No. (BEAT) No, I don’t think they are.
(DISTRACTED) An army marches on its stomach, Boney used to say. But the people left behind need to eat too...
I beg your pardon?
Well. Whatever the problem here, the Doctor can help. I promise!
(WARNING) Mel...
And if we do something for you. Perhaps you can help in return.
I’d like to know how you can help, Doctor. You can’t make the seeds grow from nothing and the rains fall?
You'd be surprised...
THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 81
Melanie, please...
Come on Doctor. We’ve got to at least try.
THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 82
Scene 45: EXT. ROAD FROM DELIKUR SPACEPORT, ON TRANSRIDER
(FX: WHEELS OF TRANSRIDER, SNORTING HELTICORE, CROWD NOISES PASSING OPEN CARRIAGE)
(CALLING FROM DRIVER'S SEAT) All aboard who’s coming aboard!
(CLIMBING ONTO CARRIAGE) What is that creature pulling this thing? Looks someone crossed a camel with an elephant!
The helticore? Native to Ridious, I believe. After you, Sisrella, Professor.
FX: HELGERT AND SISRELLA CLIMB ABOARD
Have you driven one of these before, Barlow?
(CALLING FROM DRIVER'S SEAT) I grew up with them! Didn’t used to be so expensive to hire one though... Off we go! Yah!
FX: CARRIAGE PULLED BY HELTCORE STARTS MOVING
We get the helticores to do all the long hauls now. Been in demand ever since the fuel crisis started.
Let me guess, the helticores hardly need feeding and your biofuel crops have failed as well?
Everything has, Doctor. Nothing’s grown on Ridious — nor any of the other colonies we’ve been in contact with — for the last three years, at least.
It’s the same across the ten systems. If they haven’t exhausted their stockpiles yet, they soon will.
All those people... heading into the city. Some of them can barely walk.
FX: HISSING, FAINT, OFF
THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 83
(SOTTO) What was that?
They think they’re going to find more supplies here.
All they’1l find is more overcrowding and fighting over what
there is. And that fool Elkinar doesn’t help.
He means well, Dad.
So you keep saying.
FX: HISSING, LOUDER
No... it can’t be...
(FX: ECHOING WHISPER) Here.
There it is again.
What is it Doctor?
It’s following us...
All OK back there?
A bit bumpy but we’1l live!
FX: HISSING
Stop! Stop the carriage! (BEAT) There! It’s there!
FX: BARLOW PULLS UP HELTICORE, CARRIAGE STOPS
(FX: HISSING, LOUDER) Here. He is here.
THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 84
(FX: FUZZY, FADING IN) Doctor? Are you all right?
(NORMAL) Doctor, can you hear me?
(HORRIFIED) It’s looking straight at us...
(TO OTHERS) Mel... Sisrella.. Can’t you see it?
See what? You just... zoned out for a second.
Over there. A hooded figure.
Everyone’s got hoods. The wind’s getting up and the dust gets everywhere.
No. It was... a dark... hideous thing. Its eyes... burning orange...
There’s nothing there Doctor. I’ve seen an Infinite Warrior up close. They make their presence felt.
That’s just it. I felt a... presence.
Doctor, are you sure?
(SNAPPING) Of course I’m sure, Mel. I’m not prone to making things up.
All right. Don’t bite my head off. It’s just, if no-one else can see it...
(TROUBLED) Just... let’s get on, shall we? Professor, tell me about your research.
[UNDER FOLLOWING ]
When did the blight start?
THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 85
Well. The first crops failed along the western coasts. Then it spread... Before we knew it, there was a total, planet-wide blight. We had stocks for a few years, but things got worse...]
[OVER PRECEDING]
(CLOSE, TO MEL) Does he do this often, your ‘Doctor’? Have visions, I mean?
(CLOSE) Frankly... no. And I’m starting to worry.
THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB

HELGERT: Welcome Doctor. To our humble abode.

DOCTOR WHO: Scene 48: EXT. CROP FACILITY
HELGERT: You see Doctor. Every seedling, every root. It sprouts, then withers.
HELGERT: If I could just get one single specimen to survive, I could replicate it a thousand times over in hours!
DOCTOR: Yes... I’m sure you’ve.. done your best.
DOCTOR: I think it’s clear what’s happened.
MEL: Which is what?
DOCTOR: Here, Mel. Take a look through the microscope.

DOCTOR: Look at the markers. The Professor’s highlighted the genetic abnormality.

HELGERT: Yes. The same traces on Ridious II, Trellor V, the Sansert cluster... It’s like the disease broke out across the systems instantaneously.
DOCTOR: Or rather, was introduced.
MEL: Biological warfare?
HELGERT: I was thinking along much the same lines...
DOCTOR: Somehow, the Eminence has disseminated a bio-agent across the ecosystem here, and on every other supply world.
DOCTOR WHO: THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 90
HELGERT: The Infinite Warriors never got a foothold here. They came close, but their ships were destroyed in orbit.
DOCTOR: Don’t tell me. Their vessel exploded? In the atmosphere?
HELGERT: Yes... (REALISING) Oh no. It was deliberate.
DOCTOR: As I said. A biological weapon.
DOCTOR: It must have happened across dozens of worlds. Hundreds even.
HELGERT: But we cleaned the soil. Sisrella set up whole new irrigation systems. We start afresh every time.
DOCTOR: But the bio-agent acted on the seeds themselves. Mutating them.
HELGERT: So no matter how hard I tried. These seeds were never going to grow.
MEL: It sounds like you need something from before the War started.
HELGERT: But we’ve got nothing in storage here. All the viable flora on the colonies was active. We should have put something to one Side...
MEL: ‘They took all the trees. And put them in a tree museum.’
HELGERT: What was that? (BEAT) You, young lady, are a genius!
MEL: Really? Not me. Joni Mitchell!
HELGERT: Well. We don’t have tree museums. But we do have banks.
DOCTOR: Of course! Seedbanks. Stores of all the vital reserves. A genetic backup.
DOCTOR WHO: THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 91
HELGERT: Kept on Earth. In case of disaster. Natural or otherwise. I think this counts, wouldn’t you agree?
DOCTOR: Indeed. It was after your time, Mel, but a global seed bank was established in West Sussex in the early 215+ century. It became a depository of all the world’s main cereal crops, among other things. To maintain the planet’s biodiversity.
DOCTOR: In this century it would be situated somewhere in the equatorial Administration Zones.
HELGERT: You’re right. I’ve been there! The Agricultural Antiquities Reliquaries!
MEL: I beg your pardon?
HELGERT: We had a tour. There’s a dedicated disaster recovery vault. Seeds with the base genes for fast-growing food crops.
HELGERT: If I had them, I could use my equipment to splice them, replicate them. From a few dozen seeds we could make thousands!
DOCTOR: So if we could get to Earth, Professor... To these Reliquaries...
DOCTOR: You could point us in the direction of this vault?
HELGERT: Better than that, I can print you off a map!

DOCTOR WHO: Scene 49: EXT. CROP FACILITY FIELD
BARLOW: Dad... He doesn’t look well.
SISRELLA: No. It’s been hard. The last year especially. We’d kept out of the city till now.
SISRELLA: Rationing. Riots. Delkinur’s a no go area.
BARLOW: You shouldn’t have risked it.. Coming to meet me...
SISRELLA: Oh, the military were going to be there... what could go wrong?
BARLOW: Ha! See how that worked out. She’s a good sort, Trellak. But I think she just fed the chaos, giving away our supplies.
SISRELLA: At least she fed the people in the process. For a few more weeks anyway.
BARLOW: Dad seems OK with it now. My going away...
SISRELLA: It took a while. But yeah. He knows you had to. (BEAT) He’1l be telling you his stories about getting drunk on Earth again soon enough!
BARLOW: You’ve been hearing that one again have you?

BARLOW: He seems sharp enough now.
SISRELLA: Yes, this Doctor’s given him hope. I hope he keeps his promises.
DOCTOR WHO: THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 93
BARLOW: It’s Mel who’s done all the promising.

SISRELLA: Come off it. We all heard about Earth Alliance at Ventos. Forcing them back through the Wendron Spiral... The great victory.
BARLOW: It wasn’t like that. (BEAT) The Infinite Warriors... they just gave up. Left their slave armies as cannon fodder.

DOCTOR WHO: (FX: PRINTOUT CHURNING, BEEPS AS HELGERT LOOKS UP DETAILS IN DIRECTORY )
HELGERT: There. Look. The Earth Administration Seedbank. Agricultural Antiquities. Fifty miles from Docking Blue Zone. Port 331. You can take the shuttle. Be there in ten minutes.

BARLOW: Get him on the table. Quickly, Doctor.

DOCTOR: Barlow.. I think we can stop.

MEL: His pulse is gone. It never came back...
BARLOW: You did what you could. Mel. Doctor. Thank you.

DOCTOR WHO: Scene 53: EXT. CROP FACILITY FIELD
BARLOW: Goodbye, Dad.
SISRELLA: Goodbye. (WHISPER) Love you.
DOCTOR: I’m sorry. Your father was a brilliant man. Given time... his genetic modifications... they could have worked. But it would have taken years.
SISRELLA: (SOMBRE) And we don’t have that time, do we?

DOCTOR: With your father’s accelerated growth program and your own irrigation systems, Sisrella, you could have crops in less than a year.

MEL: So. We just fall asleep in these things, and wake up on earth.
DOCTOR: (PREOCCUPIED, CHECKING SYSTEMS) It’s not exactly sleep...

MEL: Why can’t we just stay awake?

SISRELLA: (GETTING INTO POD) Watch. Climb in. Lie down. The pod does the rest.

DOCTOR: And I, another five.
BARLOW: See? (SETTING POD CONTROLS) Ready, Sis?

BARLOW: OK. See you on Earth.

BARLOW: (GETTING INTO POD) OK. Send me under. Good night, Doctor. Good night, Mel.

MEL: (GETTING INTO POD) This mattress is a bit hard.

DOCTOR WHO: THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB Page 106
MEL: See. No joke. No witty retort. You’re not even smiling.

DOCTOR: (RELIEVED) Alone. At last. (BEAT) Aaaahh! (FIGHTING IT) You’re here... aren’t you?

DOCTOR: No...
EMINENCE: We have been with you every step of the way.
DOCTOR: I know...
EMINENCE: Guiding... influencing. Ensuring you carry out our will.
DOCTOR: The will... of the Eminence...
EMINENCE: You have done well, Doctor.
DOCTOR: I... am... your... servant...
DOCTOR WHO: THE SEEDS OF WAR (002) NB
EMINENCE: You will carry out our plans. Doctor.
EMINENCE: You have taken the Breath of Life. We have shared in your mind. You share Once you have joined with the Eminence
EMINENCE: Forever!

EMINENCE: Page 107
